title: LeezHamilton
author: LeezHamilton
created_time: February 08, 2024, 12:12:39 PMLast edit: February 08, 2024, 12:25:27 PM by LeezHamilton
content: New Concern Regarding the Future of Bitcoin and Crypto Industries !I have been reading the recent news and doing a deep research on many complex matters over the last ten years. I have observed that a group of pro fiat alliance is trying to harm the progress of Bitcoin and decentralised digital currency industry. Recently I have notice some thing sinister and it is hidden in the COPA v Craig Wright case currently on hearing in London. If the conclusion the COPA suing is properly understood by the Justice Mellor and COPA win the case then the developers has nothing to fear of Craig but if the case under judged and Craig win the case then there will be chaos in the Bitcoin and Crypto industry. Therefore, I am, trying to find a solution to the later, if anything goes wrong.  As we know that don't trust but verify is the true freedom of crypto currency but governments and the  big financial institutions are the powerful entities we have to overcome. Therefore, it is time for the Bitcoin and Crypto community to be alert in every possible ways.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: There is nothing an entity or group of people or even the government can do to bring down bitcoin. Government have tried in the past to kill bitcoin but the more they try, the more bitcoin shows them that it cannot be controlled or get rid of by anyone. This has made the government to see that fact and they don't have any choice than to let bitcoin be, so that they can also benefit from bitcoin potential by the approval of Bitcoin ETF. Bitcoin is no longer a baby and nothing Wright can do about it because bitcoin is decentralized. Don't bother yourself thinking on what to do because bitcoin will fight for herself. Just relax and continue with your DCA because it is now that bitcoin will become more popular and increase in value than before.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: The centralized authority trying to harm Bitcoin as much as they can is a fact and is an old one. There is no surprise there. But the situation with the Scammer Craig is exaggerated in my opinion. That's because at the end of the day the Bitcoin Protocol is completely open source and is completely under MIT license, so it is near impossible for anyone to make any claims on the code itself and demand any changes.Not to mention that these things are "too centralized", meaning the court you are talking about is a local court not an international court capable of enforcing anything on a global scale! That's while Bitcoin is global.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: If I am not wrong, I believe in 2019, a Florida court had passed a judgement in favour of Craig about the ownership of Bitcoin. I do not remember seeing much impact on the Bitcoin market due to that decision. I am optimistic now as well. Bitcoin will not be impacted if the court decides that Craig is the Satoshi. Bitcoin is decentralized so it really doesn't matter if someone wants to change something. Every decision within network has to reach consensus. Craig cannot make arbitrary changes and the crypto market doesn't give a shit about what a court in London thinks.

comments.author: btc78
comments.body: I know that you are only preparing for the worst possible scenario but I believe that Craig Wright winning the case is quite far from happening.Why? COPA has excellent lawyers that are seeping through Wright’s facade. They have presented numerous evidences showing why Wright did not actually create bitcoin such as documents. It shows that Wright may have forged documents so he will appear to be Satoshi. However, COPA also presented credit card statements that shows inconsistency on Wright’s claims.Overall, I think Wright has a low chance of winning. This will not be the last time that someone will claim to be Satoshi or try to take credit of the success Bitcoin has right now. All we need to do is fight against those and continue to go towards a better future.

That will always remain a fact as long as the government continues to back up fiat and destroy all its competitors that would go against paper currency. But if CSW loses, it won't change anything too - everyone knows he's a liar already.
